text: The Al Grey – Billy Mitchell Sextet is an album by trombonist Al Grey and saxophonist Billy Mitchell, released in 1961 on Argo Records.Edwards, D. and Callahan, M. Argo Album Discography, Part 1: Jazz Series (1956–1965) accessed April 24, 2017Fitzgerald, M. Argo/Cadet Records Listing accessed April 24, 2017Jazzlists: Argo/Cadet discography (LP 601 to LP 699) accessed April 24, 2017 == Track listing == # "Bluish Grey" (Thad Jones) – 4:35 # "Wild Deuce" (Gene Kee) – 3:18 # "On Green Dolphin Street" (Bronisław Kaper, Ned Washington) – 2:47 # "Bantu" (Randy Weston) – 3:05 # "Melba's Blues" (Melba Liston) – 6:40 # "Home Fries" (Kee) – 3:00 # "Grey's Blues" (Al Grey) – 4:54 == Personnel == *Al Grey – trombone, baritone saxophone *Billy Mitchell – tenor saxophone, alto saxophone * Henry Boozier – trumpet * Gene Kee – piano, alto saxophone *Art Davis – bass *Jule Curtis – drums *Ray Barreto – congas == References == Category:1962 live albums Category:Billy Mitchell (jazz musician) live albums Category:Al Grey live albums Category:Argo Records live albums
title: The Al Grey - Billy Mitchell Sextet
